column4: anyone here running hoary w/ alsa and an audigy2 with no sound ?
No, anyway I have a problem that could be related.
lay it on me.
My CrystalClear SoundFusion Audio Accelerator don't work with the last kernel.
The module loads fine, but alsa claims that there's no sound card.
Under 2.6.10-1-686 it works fine.
that could be something as simple as the new kernel not being made correctly tho.
btw what is the current hoary kernel? (i roll my own)
that would def be my guess then.  same kernel w/ different options.
I'm not sure, but the last kernel was updated three or four times and my card don't work for any of the upgrades.
I've seen no error on the kernel logs.
you may not always see error on the logs.
I know.
my problem has NO errors i updated alsa-utils and then my sound stopped working.
Are you able to "see" your card under the /proc/asound directory?
yes i can.
So your problem is different than mine. My card isn't even detected.
yes.  mail-notification
even does gmail
Oh, is that the package-name ?
yes
Thanks a lot
np
I've tried it a little.
But only a pair of times. It worked fine, I think.
w/ ubuntu ?
Yes.
Hoary
are you still warty ?
No, sorry
i am hoary.  the version is .63
i have found that it requires libflac4 but i have libflac6
0.6.3 here.
I installed it yesterday or the day before yesterday with no problem.
yeah that is what i mean.
So, you're getting dependency problems?
yeah.  it wants libflac4 but only libflac6 is avail.
but there is a newer version out: .8.4 or something like that.
On hoary repositories?
yea
apt-cache show muine only gets for me the Version: 0.6.3-4
that is correct, but there is a newer version out there.
my question is: does muine play over samba.
Out where?
No idea.
Perhaps it uses gnome-vfs2 functionality
well xmms doesn't and neither does beep-media-player.
Can't you just mount that volume using nautilus?
i have.
So you mean muine is not able to access mounted volumes in nautilus?
that would be much appreciated.
Well, the muine file dialog is the old gtk one.
It seems I'm not able to see the network mounted volumes.
Because they're not mounted at SO level.
Let's try with beep-media-player.
thank you.
i wonder if i could write a plugin for muine.
i think i may look at the changelog for the newer version and see if smb support has been added.
But the point is that the smb support is only needed on gnome-vfs2
That should be enough.
understood.  but that is not what is happening here.
Perhaps you should file a bug.
maybe.  I am not quite certain where it will be approp to do so.  with gnome-vfs or every other music player.
i wonder what kde does w/ this stuff.
Not sure.
i will figure that out as time goes on.
Or just on the component you've found the bug. One not from universe or multiverse.
yes but that is a limited way of fixing the bug. i would like to know if it is a gnome-vfs problem or not.
So, file the bug on gnome-vfs2
but frankly i am not at the point where i care about the bug so much.
The gnome-vfs2 maintainer should know if it's a problem on gnome-vfs2 or not.
I recommend you to take a time searching on the bugzilla, before firing the bug.
that is what i'd do when i get there.
